intro: Pelargonium × solubile, commonly known as the hybrid geranium, is a flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is a cross between species of the genus Pelargonium, resulting in a variety that exhibits a range of flower colors and foliage types. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are typically lobed or serrated, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Pelargonium × solubile is widely cultivated as a ornamental plant for gardens and container gardening.
